item.title: OKCPS central office flubs calculation, has to reset last day of school
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Through a miscalculation, Oklahoma City Public Schools central administration officials set the wrong date for the last day of school earlier in April and, then, corrected it Thursday. Calling the error “an honest mistake,” in a written statement to the media Thursday, Chief Communications Officer Beth Harrison said that the district’s last day of school […]

The post OKCPS central office flubs calculation, has to reset last day of school appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: OKCPS Board meeting preview for April 12
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
The OKCPS Board of Education will meet Thursday to decide normal business and new proposals.

item.title: Work session covers intervention strategy, gifted-talented program
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
The Oklahoma City Public Schools Board of Education met for a work session Monday to discuss its intervention strategy and the Gifted/Talented program. The following are sketch notes taken during the flow of the meeting. Slide deck PDFs are embedded at the end to more adequately fill in some details. Board went into executive session […]

item.title: OKCPS board work session clarifies superintendent search
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Oklahoma City Public Schools Board of Education members met Monday in a work session with Oklahoma State School Boards Association staff to define what they want in the next superintendent. Gloria Torres was the only member not in attendance due to being out of the country. Process Members processed what they thought a successful district […]

The post OKCPS board work session clarifies superintendent search appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: OKCPS Board supports teacher walkout, approves teacher contracts
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
In a unanimous vote, the Oklahoma City Public Schools Board of Education passed a resolution Monday supporting the possibility of a teacher walkout over state education funding. Board members and parents expressed concern about new plans underway to expand the number of split-grade classrooms from the current 18 to 57 next year. (Watch for our […]

The post OKCPS Board supports teacher walkout, approves teacher contracts appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: OKCPS board spends hours on process to define goals
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
The Oklahoma City Public Schools Board of Education met in a work session in the superintendentâ€™s conference room Monday to start developing goals before hiring the next superintendent. The board installed newly-elected board members Ruth Veales (contested incumbent), Mark Mann (uncontested incumbent) and Jace Kirk (first term). A.J. Crabill has been hired by the district […]

item.title: Native American, African American parents to pressure OKCPS Board
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Monday night, Native American and African American parents along with supporters plan to show up in mass to pressure the Oklahoma City Public Schools Board of Education. The meeting will be at 5:30 p.m. in the auditorium at Northeast High School, 3100 N Kelley Ave. and is Northeast Parents Parents of students at Northeast High […]

item.title: Supt absence combo of vacation, prof leave says district
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
A spokesperson with Oklahoma City Public Schools denies that Superintendent Aurora Lora is on administrative leave and says she is on a combination of vacation and professional leave. Questions are circulating on social media about the whereabouts of Aurora Lora. Some have openly asked if Lora is on administrative leave. This comes during her annual […]

The post Supt absence combo of vacation, prof leave says district appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Long work session focused on planning, strategy, bonds
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
The Oklahoma City Public Schools Board of Education met Monday for an official work session in the superintendent’s conference room to discuss a wide range of issues and plans. The meeting lasted for about 4 hours, but at the end board members leaving for home seemed relaxed and satisfied with the work they put in. […]

The post Long work session focused on planning, strategy, bonds appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Principal Sue Starr back in at OKCPS, but not Northeast HS

item.description:

For the remainder of her contract ending June 30, Starr will be a roving principal in the district filling in for other principals who have to be away from […]
